sentence.Network_en: This event convulse the whole world .
Their bodies convulse, in agony , and, pain.
That frolick which shakes one man with laughter will convulse another with indignation.
sentence.Network_cn: “嘻闹”,让一个人发笑,也让另一个人义愤.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin convuls- 'pulled violently, wrenched', from the verb convellere, from con- 'together' + vellere 'to pull'

entry.tran: （使）(身体)剧烈抖动;(使)抽搐;(使)痉挛
entry.def: If someone convulses or if they are convulsed by or with something, their body moves suddenly in an uncontrolled way.

example.ex: Olivia's face convulsed in a series of twitches...
example.tran: 奥利维娅的脸上一阵抽搐。

example.ex: He let out a cry that convulsed his bulky frame and jerked his arm...
example.tran: 他大叫一声，高大的身躯剧烈地抖了一下，手臂也突然一哆嗦。

sentences.sentence: "The feverish patient thrashed around in his bed"

means.word_mean: 6. contract involuntarily, as in a spasm;

auth_sentence.content: A revolution...was to convulse England for many years.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: A revolution...was to convulse England for many years.

auth_sentence.content: They hallucinate, tumble off their boards, fight, convulse, and bleed.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: They hallucinate, tumble off their boards, fight, convulse, and bleed.

auth_sentence.content: Muscles will twitch and convulse, because the body's mechanism to tell the muscles to stop moving has been turned off.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 起痉挛的, 痉挛性的
stems_affixes.word_buile: convulse[v.使震动,震惊;使抽筋]+ive……的→adj.起痉挛的, 痉挛性的
convulse[v.使震动,震惊;使抽筋]+ion表名词→n.骚动,痉挛
revulse[v.使极其厌恶, 激起……的强烈反感]+ion表名词→n.抽回;反感;厌恶
con一起+vuls收缩,撕开+e→使收缩到一起→使抽筋

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使极其厌恶, 激起……的强烈反感
stems_affixes.word_buile: re回+vuls收缩,撕开+e→收缩回去→对……反感
